result.execSummary:
The defendant Christie M. Pergolski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week unless medically unable to do so.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

AODA and follow through if deemed appropriate by agent.  Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by Department.  

DNA sample.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 10:51 am 
INCLUDES 15CF22, 14CM2120, AND 13CM2383. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Stephen Sawyer.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 14CM2120: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF22: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                 : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                 : Ct. 4 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                 : Ct. 5 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
                 : Ct. 6 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 13CM2383: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM2120: Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CF22: Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Heroin)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 13CM2383: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ with huber for work/treatment/school/NA including but not limited to group at Methadone Clinic/AA if def qualifies and 45 days to report and 1 day jail credit to run CONCURRENT to other sentences. 
In 14CM2120: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ with huber for work/treatment/school/NA including but not limited to group at Methadone Clinic/AA if def qualifies and 45 days to report and 1 day jail credit to run CONCURRENT to other sentences. 
In 15CF22: Ct. 1>>SWH for 5 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through if deemed appropriate by agent; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week unless medically unable to do so; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 207 days jail credit if revoked in 15CF22. 
COURT does NOT order DNA sample/surcharge in 13CM2383 and 14CM2120 due to the date of the offenses. 
COURT does NOT object to jail being served on EMP. 

Adj: 11:14 am
re the Subpoena upon Confidential Informant ($75.00).
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2017 at 10:30 am.
K.H. on 2/9-2/10, 2017; Jury Trial.
Jury Trial on February 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.

INCLUDES 2015CF22, 2014CM2120, 2013CM2383.  Court modifies bond if defendant can reach agreement with Sheriff's Department for EMP or GPS.  Then court will convert $7,500 of bond to signature bond.  Defendant will still need to post $2,500 cash.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report.  Absolute sobriety.  No contact with co-defendant: B.A.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Defendant must reside with her mother and defendant's mother must co-sign $7,500 signature bond.
